Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\i18n\Formatter

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\i18n\Formatter » yii\base\Formatter » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
Formatter is the localized version of yii\base\Formatter.

Formatter requires the PHP "intl" extension to be installed. Formatter supports localized formatting of date, time and numbers, based on the current $locale.

This Formatter can replace the formatter application component that is configured by default. To do so, add the following to your application config under components:

php 'formatter' => [ 'class' => 'yii\i18n\Formatter', ]

Property Details

$dateFormat property
string $dateFormat = 'short'

The default format string to be used to format a date. This can be "short", "medium", "long", or "full", which represents a preset format of different lengths. It can also be a custom format as specified in the ICU manual.

$timeFormat property
string $timeFormat = 'short'

The default format string to be used to format a time. This can be "short", "medium", "long", or "full", which represents a preset format of different lengths. It can also be a custom format as specified in the ICU manual.

$datetimeFormat property
string $datetimeFormat = 'short'

The default format string to be used to format a date and time. This can be "short", "medium", "long", or "full", which represents a preset format of different lengths. It can also be a custom format as specified in the ICU manual.

$decimalSeparator property
string $decimalSeparator = null

The character displayed as the decimal point when formatting a number. If not set, the decimal separator corresponding to $locale will be used.

$thousandSeparator property
string $thousandSeparator = null

The character displayed as the thousands separator character when formatting a number. If not set, the thousand separator corresponding to $locale will be used.

$locale property
string $locale = null

The locale ID that is used to localize the date and number formatting. If not set, yii\base\Application::$language will be used.

$timeZone property
string|\IntlTimeZone|\DateTimeZone $timeZone = null

The timezone to use for formatting time and date values. This can be any value that may be passed to date_default_timezone_set() e.g. UTC, Europe/Berlin or America/Chicago. Refer to the php manual for available timezones. This can also be an IntlTimeZone or a DateTimeZone object. If not set, yii\base\Application::timezone will be used.

$numberFormatOptions property
array $numberFormatOptions = []

The options to be set for the NumberFormatter objects. Please refer to PHP manual for the possible options. This property is used by createNumberFormatter() when creating a new number formatter to format decimals, currencies, etc.

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

Method Details

init() method
void init( )
throws yii\base\InvalidConfigException if the "intl" PHP extension is not installed.

Initializes the component.

This method will check if the "intl" PHP extension is installed and set the default value of $locale.

asDate() method
string asDate( $value, $format = null )
$value integer|string|\DateTime The value to be formatted. The following types of value are supported: - an integer representing a UNIX timestamp - a string that can be parsed into a UNIX timestamp via strtotime() - a PHP DateTime object
$format string The format used to convert the value into a date string. If null, $dateFormat will be used. This can be "short", "medium", "long", or "full", which represents a preset format of different lengths. It can also be a custom format as specified in the ICU manual.
return string the formatted result
throws yii\base\InvalidConfigException when formatting fails due to invalid parameters.

Formats the value as a date.

See Also

  • $dateFormat
asTime() method
string asTime( $value, $format = null )
$value integer|string|\DateTime The value to be formatted. The following types of value are supported: - an integer representing a UNIX timestamp - a string that can be parsed into a UNIX timestamp via strtotime() - a PHP DateTime object
$format string The format used to convert the value into a date string. If null, $dateFormat will be used. This can be "short", "medium", "long", or "full", which represents a preset format of different lengths. It can also be a custom format as specified in the ICU manual.
return string the formatted result
throws yii\base\InvalidConfigException when formatting fails due to invalid parameters.

Formats the value as a time.

See Also

  • $timeFormat

$format string The format used to convert the value into a date string. If null, $dateFormat will be used. This can be "short", "medium", "long", or "full", which represents a preset format of different lengths. It can also be a custom format as specified in the ICU manual.
return string the formatted result
throws yii\base\InvalidConfigException when formatting fails due to invalid parameters.
